comments.body: I'm probably going to make a version of this that returns a `Maybe Bool` at some point (`auto` being `Nothing`), so the default value can depend on other things like whether the current SDK version is less than the installed SDK version.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@-- | This constructs flags that can be set to yes, no, or auto to control a boolean value
-- with auto using the default.
flagYesNoAuto :: String -> Bool -> String -> Parser Bool
flagYesNoAuto flagName defaultValue helpText =
    option reader (long flagName <> value defaultValue <> help (helpText <> commonHelp))
